results.abstract: NASA officials, seeking to avoid 'science emergency' with Hubble Space Telescope, will launch space shuttle Discovery and team of astronauts to repair failing parts on orbiting observatory in mid-Oct, eight months ahead of schedule (M)

headline.main: NASA Shuttle Mission Is Moved Up to Repair Hubble Telescope

results.snippet: Seeking to avoid a ''science emergency'' with the Hubble Space Telescope, NASA officials announced today that they would launch a space shuttle to repair failing parts on the orbiting observatory in mid-October, eight months ahead of schedule.   ...
results.lead_paragraph: Seeking to avoid a ''science emergency'' with the Hubble Space Telescope, NASA officials announced today that they would launch a space shuttle to repair failing parts on the orbiting observatory in mid-October, eight months ahead of schedule. National Aeronautics and Space Administration officials said the shuttle Discovery and a team of space-walking astronauts would be dispatched to replace malfunctioning gyroscopes that stabilize the 12.5 ton telescope and allow it to point accurately at targets across the universe.

results.abstract: Constance C R White reviews fashions at Paris show of Karl Lagerfeld; photo (M)

headline.main: Review/Fashion; Lagerfeld's Lesson for Younger Designers: Stay Relevant

results.snippet: He's been in fashion long enough for his thick black hair to gleam white -- with some artful help from powder dusting. He's seen bell-bottoms come and go and come back. He's lost his label, been abandoned by Chloe for a younger woman, and that outre...
results.lead_paragraph: He's been in fashion long enough for his thick black hair to gleam white -- with some artful help from powder dusting. He's seen bell-bottoms come and go and come back. He's lost his label, been abandoned by Chloe for a younger woman, and that outre business of posing with a fan has gone on a little too long. By all rights, Karl Lagerfeld should be working somewhere stress-free, proposing pearls and navy sweaters as the look of the new season. But on the contrary, with his latest collection for Chanel, Mr. Lagerfeld showed that he is more than capable of keeping up with Tom Ford at Gucci, Miuccia Prada, the Americans and the young Belgians who are redefining style.

results.abstract: Anita Gates reviews Farscape and First Wave, two new hourlong series being introduced by Sci-Fi Channel; photo (M)

headline.main: Aliens Ahead: Not Cute Or Cuddly Like E.T.

results.snippet: There are so many things to learn about the coming alien invasion. First, stay away from exclusive, secret downtown clubs in New York: everybody there is a space alien inhabiting a genetic duplicate of a human body. If you find yourself there anyway,...
results.lead_paragraph: There are so many things to learn about the coming alien invasion. First, stay away from exclusive, secret downtown clubs in New York: everybody there is a space alien inhabiting a genetic duplicate of a human body. If you find yourself there anyway, do not let anyone nuzzle your ear, especially someone who might be hiding a worm in his or her mouth. This is how they infect you, downloading your DNA and your memories to make a duplicate of you. The only known solution is to drink blue agave tequila, which makes the worm leave your body. I'm not making this up. Writers for ''First Wave'' did.

headline.main: Clinton 'Singed but Not Burned' at Gridiron Dinner

results.snippet: After the long and harrowing struggle to defeat impeachment, President Clinton finally joined in the general laughter at his plight on Saturday night, when he sat through a satirical dinner and had the last word with the announcement of his White...
results.lead_paragraph: After the long and harrowing struggle to defeat impeachment, President Clinton finally joined in the general laughter at his plight on Saturday night, when he sat through a satirical dinner and had the last word with the announcement of his White House memoir: ''My Story and I'm Sticking to It.'' A wave of guffaws and applause greeted the President as he gingerly kidded himself in topping off a long night of political ribbing by Washington's press establishment at the Gridiron Club's annual dinner.

results.abstract: American Airlines has stopped publishing pocket timetable, holding flight data is widely available on Internet; other airlines do not plan to follow suit, but some are making changes; Silversea Cruises adds celebrity biographer Andrew Morton to roster of year-end speakers; Princess Cruises equips its ships with portable defibrillators for treating heart attacks at sea to supplement larger defibrillators in each of ships' medical centers; All Nippon Airways to offer self-service bar and work stations in first and business classes when it begins service between Tokyo and Chicago; America West is expected to offer bargains to lure back passengers hurt by newly averted strike by flight attendants; Northwest Airlines continues to offer bargains in wake of Sept pilots' strike; Kurdish guerrillas are warning foreigners not to travel to Turkey; threaten to target resorts and other tourist destinations (M)

headline.main: Business Travel; Slowly, the airlines' pocket timetables are becoming the victims of the electronic age.

results.snippet: THE airline pocket timetable is not yet a relic, but the handy guide is becoming harder to come by. American Airlines no longer publishes one. American, a unit of  AMR, said the information -- flight numbers, departure and arrival times, stops and...
results.lead_paragraph: THE airline pocket timetable is not yet a relic, but the handy guide is becoming harder to come by. American Airlines no longer publishes one. American, a unit of AMR, said the information -- flight numbers, departure and arrival times, stops and connections -- was widely available on the Internet. The other big airlines do not plan to follow American's lead, though some are making changes. United Airlines, which spends about $2 million printing some 200,000 copies of each of its six editions yearly, has eliminated its timetables for individual cities. ''We had about 200 cities,'' said Joe Hopkins, the spokesman for United, a unit of UAL, ''so by eliminating them we saved quite a bit of money.''
